column4: I actually was using wireless then suddenly both ethernet and wireless stopped working
ifconfig eth down
of course, you need sudo and you need to specify the real eth port.
So I think I have somehow switched off the networking option and am not able to switch it on again
so, is there a different question?  I don't understand if you still need something.
Yeah, I am not able to figure out if I can switch on/off the network option from somewhere in ubuntu 9.10
or else what reasons are possible for suddent switching off of the networks
when I click on either ethernet or wireless network, the globe rotates for a long time and then it says u r disconnected
Network manager or ifconfig can take interfaces up and down.  If both go down at once, I'd suspect an external cause.
Yeah, I am able to connect to wireless through my phone
So the network is working
does that mean you are OK now?
No, so I am able to access the wireless net using my cellphone, but am not able to access it in my laptop both with ethernet and wirelessly
so it seems you have confirmed that your networking problem is not on the Ubuntu machine.  It is likely at the next step on the network.  A router/nat perhaps.  I don't know your network.
Actually I was thinking that my problem is somewhere on the ubuntu machine only as I am not able to access the internet using that machine only, When I use my phone, I am able to access the net.
So some setting is preventing me access the net from my machine

maybe. That is not what you described.  If you can talk to the internet over the cell phone, then your tcpip stack is working.  You say both wired and wireless went offline at once.  That does not sound like an Ubuntu error.  Check your cable from the Ubuntu box.  What is it plugged into?
I plugged the one end of ethernet cable into my laptop and the other in my router
Do you see a light go on on the router when the cable is plugged in?
I guess you are gone.  I am going to go eat dinner
Yes, it's showing that light in my laptop also
sorry for answering little late, are you still there
Did you get your network issues resolved?
